title: Panthers kick off 3-game road trip in Winnipeg
description: Florida faces a frigid Winnipeg and a resurgent Jets team. Can the Panthers heat up on their lengthy road journey?
fullText:
The Florida Panthers are back on the road again.

After a brief stop in South Florida for Monday‚Äôs matchup with the San Jose Sharks, the Panthers boarded a plane on Wednesday bound for the great white north.

Assuming they can defrost, Florida will kick off a three-game road trip Thursday when they face the Winnipeg Jets at Canada Life Centre.

Hopefully the Cats brought their fur layers, as the temperature on Thursday in Winnipeg has a high of minus-17 and a low of minus-22.

When they eventually hit the ice, Florida will be playing against a Jets squad that is desperately trying to bounce back from an atrocious stretch that took up most of November and December.

After winning nine of their first 12 games, the Jets went into a tailspin that peaked with an 11-game losing streak that ran from mid-December to early January.

They went from a strong 9-3-0 start to the season to holding a 15-22-5 mark on Jan. 8 (that‚Äôs a 6-19-5 run for those wondering).

Since ending the losing streak, Winnipeg has seemingly turned a corner, going 5-1-1 over the past couple weeks.

They will face a Florida squad that is also trying to make up ground and viewing every potential point in the standings as crucial.

It helps that the Panthers are getting healthier, welcoming Matthew Tkachuk into the lineup for the first time on Monday against San Jose.

With Tkachuk back in the fold, it‚Äôs just a matter of time before Florida‚Äôs forward ranks become as potent as they‚Äôve been all season, which will happen when Brad Marchand is cleared to return.

‚ÄúHe‚Äôs certainly close, day-to-day,‚Äù Maurice said of Marchand, who has missed six straight games with an undisclosed injury. ‚ÄúWhether it happens on this road trip, I don‚Äôt know yet. We are just kind of building off how he comes in each day. He felt better today than he maybe expected to (after) he got through practice. So we‚Äôll need him to wake up tomorrow at least, and then probably the next day, before we start feeling that he‚Äôs right there.‚Äù

For Maruice, any time Florida returns to Winnipeg, it‚Äôs a special night for him.

Maurice spent nine seasons coaching the Jets, leading them to the playoffs five times.

‚ÄúI do look forward to it,‚Äù Maurice said of returning to Winnipeg. ‚ÄúThere‚Äôs great memories in that place, so it‚Äôs a fun trip.‚Äù

Since joining the Panthers in 2022, Maurice has yet to see Florida pick up a victory in his old stomping grounds, going 0-3-0 in Winnipeg by a combined score of 14-5.

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt know if we‚Äôve ever won in there,‚Äù Maurice said with a smile. ‚ÄúOther than the final scores, it‚Äôs been good.‚Äù

Here are the Panthers projected lines and pairings for Thursday‚Äôs tussle in Winnipeg:

Eetu Luostarinen ‚Äì Anton Lundell ‚Äì Sam Reinhart

Carter Verhaeghe ‚Äì Sam Bennett ‚Äì Matthew Tkachuk

Mackie Samoskevich ‚Äì Evan Rodrigues ‚Äì A.J. Greer

Sandis Vilmanis ‚Äì Luke Kunin ‚Äì Jesper Boqvist

title: Houston Texans Fans Get Great News As Tank Dell Is Nearing A Return And Could Fix Several Problems
description: Hope arrives for Houston fans as explosive receiver Tank Dell nears return for the 2026 season, poised to reignite the offense and boost C.J. Stroud's performance.
fullText:
The Houston Texans are coming off a disappointing end to the 2025 season, as the franchise was blown out by the New England Patriots in the Divisional round of the playoffs. Fans may be upset with how things ended, but the franchise is in the midst of its best stretch in history, having won a postseason game in each of the last three seasons. Things could also be looking up as Tank Dell will likely be returning for the 2026 season.

Dell has faced a ton of adversity in his career. The wide receiver attended three different colleges on his way to being the Texans' third-round pick in the 2023 NFL Draft. He had an immaculate rookie season in 2023, hauling in 47 passes for over 700 yards and seven touchdowns. The young wideout has dealt with injury issues since then as he missed the entire 2025 season while recovering from a knee injury he suffered at the end of the 2024 campaign.

General Manager Nick Caserio spoke to the media on Wednesday, providing updates on many topics. He spoke about Dell, and the executive shared that the wide receiver should be ready to go for the team's offseason program.

#Texans GM Nick Caserio says the team expects Tank Dell to be ready for the offseason program.

‚Äî Sam Warren (@samwarren_3) January 21, 2026

This is great news, as it means Dell will return to the lineup for the 2026 season. This brings Houston back one of its offensive weapons, while also giving quarterback C.J. Stroud back one of his favorite targets.

Dell and Stroud have always had a good connection, as evidenced by each player's numbers when they are on the field together. Dell has played in just 25 games in his career and has amassed 1,300 receiving yards while scoring 10 touchdowns. It's almost as if he makes the game a little bit easier for Stroud, which is something fans in Houston would like to see after the quarterback regressed once again during the 2025 campaign.

Stroud has been trying to get back to playing the way he did during his rookie season, but the quarterback has taken steps backward in his second and third years in the league. Dell returning to the lineup might spark some confidence in the quarterback, which hopefully will allow him to play the way he did in 2023.

The wide receiver room is a little more crowded now than it was in 2023, but Dell will hopefully fit back into the offense seamlessly once he is fully recovered from his injury.

title: Women's League Cup to undergo name and format changes
description: England's secondary cup competition will adopt a format like the Champions League from next season ‚Äì and will "probably not" be called the League Cup.
fullText:
The Women's League Cup is undergoing a major revamp for next season which will include adopting a similar format to the Champions League and possibly altering its name.

It has already been confirmed that Women's Super League (WSL) clubs who qualify for the Women's Champions League will not compete.

And in further changes, the WSL has said it plans to introduce a Swiss-style format for the league phase to guarantee more games for all participating teams.

Currently, all WSL2 and some WSL teams play in round-robin groups of four or five in the first round, with the winners progressing to the quarter-finals. Teams taking part in the Champions League - Arsenal, Chelsea and Manchester United this season - enter at the knockout stage.

In the revamped competition, all participating clubs would enter the league phase and be drawn to play six other sides.

The top eight teams in the league phase would progress to the quarter-finals. Unlike in the Champions League, there will be no play-off round because there is no space in the fixture calendar.

The name of the competition is still being discussed. It will "probably not" be called the League Cup because it will not have all the league teams involved.

A WSL spokesperson said other options, including scrapping the League Cup, had been considered, but they felt these changes would give "clarity of purpose" to the competition.

"The calendar is one of the biggest constraints and challenges, there is only so much space on weekends for us to work with," the spokesperson said.

"We've listened to fans and clubs, and it felt like it didn't have complete purpose, including Champions League teams entering at the quarter-final stage.

"We even put on the table, do we not have a secondary cup competition?

"But the challenge is that top players at top clubs get loads of minutes, loads of matches. If you are in the WSL2, you have a real disparity ‚Äì we want to close that gap.

"We looked at whether Champions League clubs could enter a secondary team, but at this stage we deemed it was not possible."

The spokesperson said plans were being finalised with clubs and commercial partners, and would be put before the Football Association within the next four weeks.

The changes come amid the women's domestic calendar growing ever more crowded.

The Women's Champions League this season expanded from 16 to 18 clubs at the league phase, with Chelsea, Arsenal and Manchester United involved ‚Äì the first time three WSL teams had reached that point.

Arsenal and Manchester United will play in the knockout play-offs ‚Äì a new round of games introduced this season - after finishing fifth and sixth respectively in the league.

Next year the number of domestic top-flight games is also set to increase following the expansion of the WSL from 12 to 14 teams.

WSL organisers have confirmed that teams who play in the Champions League will not drop into the secondary domestic cup even if they fail to progress through the qualifying rounds.

BBC Sport also understands that the league phase will still be regionalised, as it is currently, to help clubs with travel time and costs.

Sponsorship of the competition is also uncertain. The deal with current sponsors Subway expires this summer, although it has an option to extend the contract by a year.

Ben Haines, Ellen White and Jen Beattie are back for another season of the Women's Football Weekly podcast. New episodes drop every Tuesday on BBC Sounds, plus find interviews and extra content from the Women's Super League and beyond on the Women's Football Weekly feed

Women's Club World Cup could be 'catastrophic' for WSL

Get the latest WSL news on our dedicated page

title: Boston Celtics legend Larry Bird weighs in on the NBA's 3-point revolution
description: Bird had his own ideas about what the league ought to do about the growing rate of shots coming from beyond the arc.
fullText:
There have been concerns in NBA circles about the 3-point shot in the league almost as long as there has been one. And, present for the first-ever trey sunk in the history of the Association, Hall of Fame Boston Celtics forward Larry Bird had his own ideas about what the league ought to do about the growing rate of shots coming from beyond the arc.

One can argue he played well before it ever reached anything close to the volume of the modern game, but who is not going to listen to the Hick From French Lick when it comes to basketball? The folks behind the "Basketball Network" YouTube channel put together a clip dialing in on Bird's thoughts about what ought to be done regarding the explosion of 3-point shots in the league.

Take a look at the clip embedded below to hear what they had to say about Larry Legend and his trey opinions.

title: Chris Burke appointed as Brentford B assistant coach
description: Chris Burke has joined Brentford B as assistant coach.Burke arrives having held roles as Kilmarnock‚Äôs Under-19s head coach and the club's head of development.The former midfielder came through Range...
fullText:
The former midfielder came through Rangers‚Äô academy, going on to make 131 appearances - eight of which were in the Champions League - and scoring 14 goals.

He then moved to England and spent the bulk of his playing days in the EFL, first with Cardiff City, before a three-season spell at Birmingham City.

He joined Nottingham Forest in 2014 and had a short loan at Rotherham United, before returning to Scotland with Ross County. He transferred to Kilmarnock in 2017, where he ended his playing career after five years at Killie.

Burke also made seven caps for Scotland, scoring two goals for his country.

Burke makes the move to west London following a coaching spell at his former club Kilmarnock, where he worked across the club‚Äôs U18s and U19s age groups, before gaining experience with their first team, and was then later appointed head of development.

He also served as assistant coach to Brentford first-team coach Neil MacFarlane with Scotland Under-19s last season.

On the appointment, Brentford interim academy director Jamie Greenwood said: ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre really pleased to welcome Chris to the club following a thorough recruitment process.

‚ÄúChris brings valuable coaching experience at both club and international level, alongside a strong professional playing background, which we believe will add real value to our B-team environment.

‚ÄúHe has a clear understanding of player development and the demands of the pathway, and we‚Äôre confident he will play an important role in supporting our young players as they continue their transition towards first-team football.‚Äù

title: üîê Simeone hits a wall, Marc Pubill decisive against Galatasaray
description: Atl√©tico Madrid couldn't get past a draw in their Champions League match against Galatasaray. However, the big surprise of the night wasn't the result, but the performance of Marc Pubill.Due to absen...
fullText:
Atl√©tico Madrid couldn't get past a draw in their Champions League match against Galatasaray. However, the big surprise of the night wasn't the result, but the performance of Marc Pubill.

Due to absences in the defense, Simeone opted for the young full-back as a central defender, a risky decision that ended up resulting in a tactical showcase.

Pubill recorded an impeccable statistic in ball distribution with a 90.2% pass accuracy (37 out of 41 completed). His ability to interpret the game allowed the team to maintain possession under pressure, also adding zero ball losses in critical areas, a vital stat for his new position.

In the defensive aspect, the touch map reveals a constant presence in his own area and the central lane. His reading of the plays allowed him to intercept key balls that cut off the Turkish team's quick transitions.

With 59 total touches, the player demonstrated that his versatility is an invaluable asset for "El Cholo's" scheme. This performance not only secures the three points in Europe but also opens up a new range of tactical possibilities for the rest of the season.

title: Mercedes unveils striking W17 ahead of 2026 F1 season
description: Mercedes debuts the W17, their challenger for the 2026 F1 season
fullText:
Mercedes became the latest Formula 1 team to share their look for the new season, unveiling the striking W17 with a series of images released on Thursday.

The technical elements are in line with the incoming set of regulations, geared towards making the cars smaller, lighter, and more agile. The front and rear wings are smaller and the car is narrower overall, particularly when compared with previous season.

From a livery standpoint, the design is a departure from what we have seen from Mercedes in previous years. A green line ‚Äî a nod to title partner Petronas ‚Äî anchors the car from the nose to the rear, drawing attention to a ‚Äútransition‚Äù from silver to black as the eye trails along the W17. The iconic Mercedes three-pointed star dots the engine cover, while the sidepods contain a stunning array of silver lines.

Top-down on the Mercedes W17 üëÅÔ∏è#F1 @MercedesAMGF1 pic.twitter.com/MCTYSll4K9

‚Äî Formula 1 (@F1) January 22, 2026

‚ÄúFormula One will undergo significant change in 2026, and we are prepared for that transition. The new regulations demand innovation and absolute focus across every area of performance. Our work on the new car, and the long-term development of the Power Unit and advanced sustainable fuels with Petronas, reflects that approach,‚Äù said Mercedes Team Principal Toto Wolff. 

‚ÄúReleasing the first images of the W17 is simply the next step in that process. It represents the collective, sustained effort of our teams in Brixworth and Brackley. We will continue to push hard in the months ahead.‚Äù

Up next for Mercedes ‚Äî and the rest of the grid ‚Äî is next week‚Äôs Barcelona Shakedown, where the teams will put their 2026 challengers through a private testing session. Two more testing sessions in Bahrain will follow next month.

The Silver Arrows will also officially unveil the W17 at a season launch event on February 2.

title: Real Madrid Set the Global Financial Standard
description: Los Blancos have once again been crowned the highest-revenue club in world football according to Deloitte
fullText:
Real Madrid continue to operate in a financial stratosphere of their own. According to Deloitte‚Äôs latest Football Money League report, Los Blancos have once again been crowned the highest-revenue club in world football ‚Äî and by a significant margin.

For the third consecutive year, the club tops Deloitte‚Äôs global ranking after generating ‚Ç¨1.161 billion in revenue during the 2024‚Äì25 season. That figure represents a year-on-year increase of ‚Ç¨115.5 million and places Real Madrid nearly ‚Ç¨200 million ahead of second-placed Barcelona (‚Ç¨974.8m). It also puts them well clear of the Premier League‚Äôs financial heavyweights, with Liverpool the highest English club in fifth place on ‚Ç¨836.1m.

Crossing the ‚Ç¨1.1 billion threshold further cements Real Madrid‚Äôs status as football‚Äôs dominant economic force. What makes the achievement even more striking is that it comes despite a season without major silverware on the pitch in 2023‚Äì24. While trophies remain the club‚Äôs ultimate objective, the numbers underline Madrid‚Äôs ability to thrive financially regardless of short-term sporting outcomes.

Deloitte notes that football‚Äôs three primary revenue streams ‚Äî commercial, broadcasting, and matchday income ‚Äî all reached record levels across the industry. Real Madrid were uniquely positioned to take advantage of this growth, consolidating their place at the top of the global game.

Key contributors included revenue generated through the operation of the renovated Santiago Bernab√©u, alongside income from participation in elite competitions such as the Champions League and the Club World Cup.

The central pillar of Real Madrid‚Äôs financial dominance remains its commercial arm. According to Deloitte, the club‚Äôs commercial revenue increased by 23% over the previous season, fueled by stronger merchandising sales and the addition of new global commercial partners.

The scale of that growth is such that Real Madrid‚Äôs commercial revenue alone would be enough to rank the club inside the top ten of the Money League ‚Äî a threshold currently occupied by Chelsea at ‚Ç¨584.1m in total revenue. This commercial strength also helped Madrid absorb a 6% drop in matchday revenue, largely linked to fluctuations tied to stadium usage and scheduling.

In short, Real Madrid‚Äôs business model is no longer dependent on any single income stream. Instead, it is built on diversification, global reach, and the growing monetization of the Bernab√©u as a multi-purpose venue.

Below is the full top-20 ranking from Deloitte‚Äôs report, highlighting just how far ahead Real Madrid currently stand:

The latest Money League figures reinforce a trend that has been developing for years: Real Madrid are not merely competing with Europe‚Äôs elite ‚Äî they are financially separating from them (at least from a revenue standpoint). With sustained growth across commercial partnerships, global merchandising, and stadium-driven revenue, the club has set a benchmark few others appear capable of matching.

As football‚Äôs economic landscape continues to evolve, Deloitte‚Äôs report makes one thing clear: when it comes to revenue generation, Real Madrid are not just winning ‚Äî they are redefining the scale of the game.

title: C.J. Anderson: Broncos can beat Patriots with backup QB like they did in 2015
description: In 2015, the Broncos beat the Patriots with a backup QB when RB C.J. Anderson had a game-winning touchdown in OT.
fullText:
C.J. Anderson knows what it's like to beat the New England Patriots with a backup quarterback under center.

During the 2025 season, starting quarterback Peyton Manning went down with a foot injury and Brock Osweiler was called on to start in his place. Osweiler ended up going 5-2 as a starter, including a 30-24 win against the Patriots in Week 11.

Denver Broncos running back C.J. Anderson rushed 15 times for 113 yards and two touchdowns in that contest, including a 48-yard game-winner in overtime. That victory helped Denver (12-4) claim the No. 1 playoff seed over New England (12-4) later in the season.

That time the Broncos had a comeback win over the Patriots with C.J. Anderson‚Äôs 48-yard touchdown run in overtime. üî• pic.twitter.com/n6956b3izO

‚Äî Sunday Night Football on NBC (@SNFonNBC) July 13, 2024

Ten years later, the Broncos are set to face the Patriots in the AFC Championship game with backup quarterback Jarrett Stidham under center following Bo Nix's season-ending ankle injury. Denver could get running back J.K. Dobbins (foot) back from injured reserve in time for the game, and Anderson believes the Broncos can upset New England.

If the Defense is like 2015 then you find a way to win 2 games out Defense took on the challenge and they step up. RB‚Äôs step up defense step up rally behind JS and go find a way to win at home

‚Äî Cj Anderson (@cjandersonb22) January 18, 2026

Led by a talented defense and a productive rushing attack, Anderson believes Denver can beat the Patriots again, just like they did in 2015. Two months after that regular season showdown, the Broncos hosted New England again in the AFC title game and won 20-18. Fans in Denver will hope to see history repeat on Sunday.

title: Is Oregon State women's basketball tracking for March Madness?
description: Oregon State women's basketball is beyond the halfway point of the 2025-26 season. Are the Beavers on track for March Madness?
fullText:
The NCAA women‚Äôs basketball season has crossed over the halfway point.

Eyes are starting to turn toward postseason basketball as teams establish resumes worthy of a March Madness appearance.

Among them is Oregon State, which sits near the top of the West Coast Conference and is 14-6 overall (6-1 WCC) heading into the Jan. 22 home conference matchup with Gonzaga (also 14-6, 6-1)

Leading the charge for the Beavers this season is junior guard Jenna Villa, a Washington native who‚Äôs averaging a team-high 15.9 points per game.

Next to her are a pair of guards, Kennedie Shuler and Tiara Bolden, who are both averaging above 10 points per game. Shuler dishes out a team-high 5.6 assists per game, which is among the 25 best individual tallies in the nation.

Wins against Illinois, Utah State, Colorado State and a slew of WCC competition bolster the Oregon State resume, while the Beavers have losses to teams including Vanderbilt, No. 4 team in the USA Today‚Äôs coaches poll, Oregon and Arizona State.

How do the Beavers‚Äô March Madness hopes stack up to the rest of the country?

The clearest path to March Madness for any team is to win the conference tournament. In 2025, Oregon State won the WCC tournament to earn an automatic bid to the dance.

This season, a competitive field of WCC opposition will challenge the Beavers to retain the throne.

Gonzaga, Oregon State and Santa Clara boast overall records securely above .500, while Loyola Marymount and Portland also hold strong conference records midway through the season.

All will be decided March 5-10 in Las Vegas, when the WCC hosts its conference championship. It‚Äôs a strong field, and bracketologists have conflicting predictions for which school will stand above the rest in the West Coast Conference.

In one prediction made by CBS‚Äô Connor Groel, Gonzaga claims the WCC title to earn an automatic bid as a 12 seed. In another by ESPN‚Äôs Charlie Creme, the Beavers take WCC gold and an automatic bid as a 13 seed.

The WCC, notably, didn‚Äôt receive an at-large bid in 2025 but did in 2024 with Gonzaga.

According to the NCAA, at-large bids are decided by a committee with a 10-step process that gathers a list of nominations, which is followed by an eight-step process that then ranks those nominations. Restrictions to nominees are lenient, but teams must hold a .500-or-better overall record.

Oregon State was 84th in the NCAA NET rankings, a tool used in the selection process, through Jan. 20 games.

Oregon State has become a familiar face in the field of 68 teams for the past decade or so under coach Scott Rueck.

Since 2014, the Beavers have appeared in the Big Dance nine times. Of those nine, five have resulted in Sweet Sixteen appearances. Of those five, three ended in the Elite Eight.

The 2016 OSU team made it to the Final Four.

When Rueck took over the program in 2010, something changed in Corvallis.

Rueck‚Äôs teams have been ranked in the top 25 in 10 different seasons. Rueck was named Pac-12 Conference coach of the year five times, he‚Äôs been nominated for numerous national coach of the year awards and OSU has won the Pac-12 three times.

Prior to Rueck‚Äôs tenure, the Beavers had only made March Madness five times in school history.

Landon Bartlett covers Oregon State and high school sports for the Statesman Journal. He can be reached at LBartlett@statesmanjournal.com or on X or Instagram @bartlelo.

This article originally appeared on Salem Statesman Journal: Is Oregon State women's basketball tracking for March Madness?

title: Chiefs TE Travis Kelce reacts to the return of OC Eric Bieniemy
description: During the latest New Heights, Kansas City Chiefs tight end Travis Kelce reacted to the return of offensive coordinator Eric Bieniemy | @EdEastonJr
fullText:
During the recent episode of the New Heights podcast, Kansas City Chiefs tight end Travis Kelce shared his reaction to the return of offensive coordinator Eric Bieniemy.

"I love that s***. I think it's great. I think it's a marriage that's gonna pick up right where it left off. EB (Eric Bieniemy) and who he is as a coach, you can see kinda his personality and what he brings to the table on that Chicago team."

‚ÄúI can‚Äôt wait to see him back in the building he‚Äôs one of my favorite coaches of all time‚Äù

Travis shared his thoughts on (a possibly shirtless) Eric Bieniemy returning to the Chiefs pic.twitter.com/MRmdNAcIar

‚Äî New Heights (@newheightshow) January 21, 2026

Kansas City moved quickly to bring back Bieniemy after realizing Matt Nagy would move on for potential head coaching opportunities. Kelce expressed greater enthusiasm about Bieniemy's return, noting his anticipated appearance at the facility.

"I can't wait to see him back in the building, man. He's one of my favorite coaches of all time. He's one of my favorite people of all time," said Kelce, "I've had so many unbelievable growing moments under him as a player, as a person. I just love the guy. It's gonna be awesome to see him back in the building and see him back wearing the Chiefs' logo, baby."

Bieniemy spent nine years as an assistant coach and coordinator with Kansas City before joining the Washington Commanders as their offensive coordinator and assistant head coach for the 2023 season.

This article originally appeared on Chiefs Wire: Chiefs TE Travis Kelce reacts to the return of OC Eric Bieniemy

title: The Athletic‚Äôs top 15 leaders in sports
description: Leadership is the invisible currency of sports. Hard to quantify, but impossible to win without. The Athletic surveyed over 100 industry insiders to find the figures who command the most respect in 2025. From tacticians to culture-setters, these are the‚Ä¶
fullText:
Leadership is the invisible currency of sports. Hard to quantify, but impossible to win without. The Athletic surveyed over 100 industry insiders to find the figures who command the most respect in 2025. From tacticians to culture-setters, these are the names that define the modern standard. Here are the top 15 most admired leaders.

Role:¬†Quarterback, Kansas City Chiefs‚Äã
Mahomes makes the list because his leadership is as effortless as his playmaking. He balances supreme confidence with a calming presence that stabilizes the entire franchise when chaos hits. He isn‚Äôt just the face of the Chiefs; he is the league‚Äôs competitive north star.‚Äã

Role:¬†President of Basketball Operations, Boston Celtics‚Äã
Transitioning from the sideline to the front office, Stevens proved that elite basketball IQ translates anywhere. He is admired for his cold, decisive roster management, prioritizing winning combinations over sentimentality. His vision turned a good team into a perennial juggernaut.‚Äã

Role:¬†Head Coach (Former)‚Äã
Carroll‚Äôs legacy is built on a high-energy, positive culture that allowed players to be themselves. His ‚Äúalways compete‚Äù mantra wasn‚Äôt just a slogan; it was a daily way of life that resonated across generations of athletes. He remains the blueprint for the modern players‚Äô coach.‚Äã

Role:¬†Quarterback, Philadelphia Eagles‚Äã
Hurts commands respect through a stoic demeanor that never fluctuates, regardless of the scoreboard. His leadership is quiet but heavy, grounded in a relentless work ethic that sets the temperature for the entire building. In a volatile market, he is the unshakeable constant.‚Äã

Role:¬†Head Coach, Michigan State‚Äã
The ultimate throwback, Izzo leads with a mix of brutal accountability and genuine, familial love. His teams mirror his identity: tough, physical, and built to survive the grind of March. Peers admire him for the fierce loyalty he inspires in everyone who wears the jersey.‚Äã

Role:¬†Head Coach, Pittsburgh Steelers‚Äã
Tomlin is the master of messaging, known for cutting through the noise with honesty that players crave. His greatest skill is his consistency; he prevents the floor from dropping out, no matter the roster turnover. He remains the standard for stability in the NFL.‚Äã

Role:¬†Forward, Las Vegas Aces‚Äã
Wilson has become the WNBA‚Äôs undisputed face, carrying the league‚Äôs growth with grace and dominance. She leads with accessibility and humor, anchoring a dynasty while shouldering the expectations of a superstar. She makes greatness look relatable.‚Äã

Role:¬†Head Coach, Detroit Lions‚Äã
Campbell turned a punchline into a powerhouse by doubling down on authenticity and grit. He proved that vulnerability can be a strength, building a locker room that fights harder because they truly believe in the man leading them. His team is a direct reflection of his heart.‚Äã

Role:¬†Head Coach, USWNT‚Äã
Hayes brings a psychological edge to management, treating athletes as whole people to unlock their best performance. Her rapid success with Chelsea and the USWNT on the international stage showcased her ability to diagnose and fix culture instantly. She is a tactician who understands the human element first.‚Äã

Role:¬†General Manager, OKC Thunder‚Äã
Presti is the long-game visionary who wasn‚Äôt afraid to look foolish in the short term to build something lasting. His disciplined approach to asset accumulation set a new template for success in small markets. He wins by sticking to the plan when others panic.‚Äã

Role:¬†Head Coach, Kansas City Chiefs‚Äã
Reid is the rare genius who lacks an ego, creating a collaborative environment where players‚Äô personalities thrive. His offensive creativity is legendary, but his steady, fatherly hand is what keeps the dynasty humming. He makes the grind of football feel like a joyride.‚Äã

Role:¬†Head Coach, UConn‚Äã
Auriemma demands a level of perfectionism that most programs can‚Äôt comprehend. His abrasive style works because it is rooted in a deep, relentless drive to extract every ounce of potential from his players. To play for him is to ‚Äã

Role:¬†Point Guard, Golden State Warriors‚Äã
Curry‚Äôs leadership is defined by ‚Äújoyful energy,‚Äù a selfless vibe that allowed a dynasty to breathe without ego battles. He is the rare alpha who invites others to share the spotlight rather than hoarding it. His presence dissolves tension and elevates everyone.‚Äã

Role:¬†Head Coach, South Carolina‚Äã
Staley is a ‚Äútruth-teller‚Äù who advocates fiercely for her players and the sport itself. She built a powerhouse by being a mentor first and a coach second, earning unshakeable trust from her roster. Her voice resonates far beyond the court.‚Äã

Role:¬†Head Coach, Golden State Warriors‚Äã
Kerr tops the list for his mastery of the soft skills, managing massive egos and keeping a dynasty hungry over a decade. His leadership is defined by emotional intelligence and perspective, keeping the game in balance for his team. He is the ultimate people manager.‚Äã

These fifteen leaders share one trait: the ability to make those around them better. Whether through tactical brilliance or emotional connection, they set the bar that the rest of the sports world chases.‚Äã

The post The Athletic‚Äôs top 15 leaders in sports appeared first on The Big Lead.

title: Where Clemson lands in Andy Katz's NCAA Tournament bracket
description: Clemson's ranking in Andy Katz's first NCAA Tournament bracket does not disappoint after a performances against Miami and NC State.
fullText:
Clemson Basketball has been on fire as of recent being 6-1 in ACC play and 16-4 overall record as well as boasting a 10-1 winning rate at home. It should come as no surprise to see that Clemson has been ranked high in Andy Katz's first NCAA Tournament bracket.

This ranking might look eerily similar to those who followed last season and it would be right to have this mindset. Last year Clemson came in at the 5 seed squaring off against 12 seed McNeese State Cowboys, which lead to a 69-67 upset knocking Clemson out in the first round.

But this time around the projections is that we would be playing Yale who currently sits second at 3-1 in the conference and 14-3 overall. They are currently in a tight Ivy League title race with Dartmouth. Last year Yale was the #13 seed and was knocked out by the #4 seed Texas A&M Aggies. There biggest game is a matchup coming up is against Dartmouth on January 30th.

title: Members of Texas A&M baseball's roster earn Perfect Game USA honors
description: Six members of the Texas A&M baseball roster were named to Perfect Game USA's Top Players by Class.
fullText:
Texas A&M baseball head coach Michael Earley's roster continues to garner national preseason accolades entering his second year at the helm in College Station.

According to Perfect Game USA's Top Players by Class list, six Aggies were recognized as some of the best players in college baseball in their respective classes. It includes juniors Caden Sorrell, Chris Hacopian, Gavin Grahovac, and Shane Sdao, sophomore Terrence Kiel II, and freshman Nico Partida. After losing many top contributors to the MLB Draft in the spring of 2025, Earley reloaded well in the transfer portal and maintained decent roster retention.

Texas A&M will look to put last year's woes behind it and turn the page to a new chapter in 2026. To accomplish that feat, it will take talent like Perfect Game USA's Aggie selections to contribute and stay healthy throughout the upcoming season.

See which Aggies made the @PerfectGameUSA Top Players by Class list this season üîù üëÄ#GigEm pic.twitter.com/xOnyFyp13w

‚Äî Texas A&M Baseball (@AggieBaseball) January 21, 2026

The Maroon and White stood atop the national preseason rankings before last season's first pitch, but it didn't last long. While Texas A&M's roster suffered many injuries to open last year's efforts, the team's underwhelming performances led to the Aggies becoming the first preseason No. 1 to miss the postseason since 1991. As a result, some national journalists, such as Baseball America's Jacob Rudner, have avoided ranking the program in the top 25.

"So, what‚Äôs the holdup? The decision to hold Texas A&M out is rooted entirely in last season‚Äôs outcome. A year ago, a similarly talented roster opened the season ranked No. 1 and missed the NCAA Tournament altogether. Michael Earley retooled his staff this offseason and early returns have been positive, but until the Aggies translate that talent into consistent results, the benefit of the doubt is withheld. The expectation is not whether Texas A&M belongs in the rankings, but whether or not it will prove it does," Rudner said.

Texas A&M's first pitch of 2026 is scheduled for Friday, Feb. 13, against the Tennessee Tech Golden Eagles in College Station. Game 1 is set for 6 p.m., with Games 2 and 3 scheduled for 2 p.m. CT on Saturday, February 14, and 12 p.m. CT on Sunday, February 15, respectively.

Contact/Follow us¬†@AggiesWire¬†on X¬†(formerly Twitter) and like our page on¬†Facebook¬†to follow ongoing coverage of Texas A&M news, notes and opinions.¬†Follow Dylan on X:¬†@dylanmflippo.

title: Jarrett Stidham: I'm not treating my preparation any differently
description: Jarrett Stidham has started four games in his NFL career and all of them came at the end of losing seasons, so he has no experience with what he's going to experience this weekend.
fullText:
Jarrett Stidham has started four games in his NFL career and all of them came at the end of losing seasons, so he has no experience with what he's going to experience this weekend.

Bo Nix's fractured ankle has thrust Stidham into the starting quarterback spot for the Broncos in this Sunday's AFC Championship Game against the Patriots. The implications of the game for both the Broncos and Stidham are clear.

A win would send the Broncos to the Super Bowl and it would take Stidham from unheralded backup to a household name overnight. On Wednesday, Stidham said he knows this is "not about myself" but how he can "help my teammates succeed on Sunday." He said the approach to doing that is by keeping things as routine as possible despite the unusual circumstances.

"I think what I always go back to ‚Äî in any game, regular season, preseason, the AFC Championship ‚Äî it's still the same game," Stidham said, via the team's website. "Obviously, there are implications and winner advances, all that kind of stuff, but at the end of the day, it's still football. That's how I view it. I'm not treating it any differently. I'm not treating my preparation any differently. I'm just going to go out there and play and be myself. I think that's the biggest thing. I'm not going to try to be somebody that I'm not. I know how I can play, and I know the kind of guys I have around me and the kind of team that we have. So, we all just have to play within ourselves."

Broncos teammates and head coach Sean Payton have expressed confidence in Stidham's ability to handle being thrown into the fire in a do-or-die situation, but one look at the odds shows how much doubt exists outside of the organization. Stidham won't be able to quiet that before Sunday, so it is something else to ignore as he prepares for the biggest moment of his professional career.

title: See how Marcus Freeman voted in the final US LBM Coaches Poll
description: Notre Dame head coach Marcus Freeman‚Äôs final US LBM Coaches Poll vote had Alabama lower than more and did not rank rival USC.
fullText:
It‚Äôs always interesting to see how a head coach votes during the final US LBM Coaches Poll, and for Notre Dame‚Äôs Marcus Freeman, he certainly tried to make a statement as shared by Tyler Horka.

For some odd reason, Alabama was still ranked ahead of the Irish, but not according to Freeman, who had the Crimson Tide a spot behind his team at No. 10. He also placed Brigham Young, a Notre Dame 2026 opponent who also was skipped over in the College Football Playoff at No. 11.

There was a big omission as well, as Freeman opted to leave USC out of his top-25 all-together. This was most likely a jab at the Trojans, who decided that they couldn‚Äôt play Notre Dame anymore due to the potential of missing out on the CFP. It was a weak eat out of the storied rivalry, and Freeman made sure they knew it as well.

It was fun to see how the Irish‚Äôs leader opted to vote in the final coaches poll, as he most likely didn‚Äôt have one of his staff members submit the picks.

This is Marcus Freeman‚Äôs final Coaches Poll ballot of the 2025 season, via @usatodaysports.

Of note, out of 62 coaches‚Ä¶

-He was one of 16 who had Notre Dame ranked ahead of Alabama.

-He was one of 16 who did not rank USC. pic.twitter.com/T8em4buRBM

‚Äî Tyler Horka (@tbhorka) January 21, 2026

title: Big 12 basketball power rankings: Iowa State's Joshua Jefferson rebounds in big way
description: Iowa State's Joshua Jefferson become the first player in program history to record multiple triple-doubles in a season, ending a two-game slide.
fullText:
Iowa State star Joshua Jefferson had every opportunity to be a football player.

His father, Ben, played at Maryland along with the NFL and CFL. His two brothers played collegiately, with Cameron winning the Super Bowl with the Denver Broncos.

All are large humans on the offensive or defensive line.

Yet, Joshua chose basketball early. And with his 6-foot-9, 240-pound frame, he‚Äôs been a monster for the Cyclones.

And the biggest reason for their most recent bounceback.

After struggling for two games ‚Äî both the Cyclones‚Äô first and second loss of the year ‚Äî he responded with a triple-double in a rout of UCF, becoming the first Cyclone to have multiple triple-doubles in a season.

Johnson had 17 points, 12 assists and 10 rebounds. He made 6 of 11 shots and had no turnovers.

‚ÄúI'm just proud of his ability mentally to lock in on the things that are important for us to be successful,‚Äù Iowa State coach TJ Otzelberger said, ‚Äúand now we just gotta work together and maintain that every night out."

If Iowa State gets that every night from Jefferson, the two-game blip will be forgotten deep into March.

Let‚Äôs get to this week‚Äôs Big 12 power rankings.

More: Iowa State basketball gets back to being Iowa State basketball | Hines

This week: vs. West Virginia (Saturday); at BYU (Monday)

What to know: The Wildcats are one of only three unbeaten teams remaining around the country. And it really hasn‚Äôt been close in league play. They‚Äôve beaten each team by at least nine points.

This week: at Texas Tech (Saturday); at TCU (Wednesday)

What to know: The Cougars, winners of 11 straight, have won their last three games by an average of 27 points. Twenty-seven! That‚Äôs unheard of in the Big 12.

This week: at Oklahoma State (Saturday); vs. Colorado (Thursday)

What to know: The Cyclones uncharacteristically lost two straight games then took out their frustrations on UCF. Getting back to lock-down defense was key, but Jefferson getting right was crucial.

This week: vs. Houston (Saturday)

What to know: The Red Raiders set a Big 12 record with 14 first-half 3-pointers in a demolition of Baylor. They tied a program record with 17 3s in the game. So, now the team with the reigning Big 12 Player of the Year can overwhelm others from deep.

More: Texas Tech basketball demolishes Baylor behind trio of 20-point scorers

This week: vs. Arizona (Monday)

What to know: Robert Wright III has been an excellent addition for the Cougars. The Baylor transfer is averaging 22.2 points in Big 12 play. He‚Äôs been so valuable that he missed one whole minute against Texas Tech, which went on a 6-0 run without him to take control.

This week: at Kansas State (Saturday)

What to know: The Jayhawks have three straight wins but the health of coach Bill Self is the biggest concern. Here‚Äôs to hoping he is back on the team‚Äôs bench sooner than later.

This week: at Colorado (Saturday); vs. Arizona State (Tuesday)

What to know: The Knights suffered back-to-back losses for the first time all season. Being without Jamichael Stillwell and losing Jeremy Foumena to an injury is a big problem for a team with a NCAA Tournament resume.

This week: at Baylor (Saturday); vs. Houston (Wednesday)

What to know: David Punch is having a breakout season. His latest gem was a double-double and game-winning shot in a wild comeback over Oklahoma State. That avoided a five-game skid for the Frogs.

This week: vs. TCU (Saturday); at Cincinnati (Wednesday)

What to know: The Bears are 1-5 in league play, but they have losses to conference contenders Iowa State, Houston, Kansas and Texas Tech. A softer schedule awaits.

This week: at Arizona (Saturday); vs. Kansas State (Tuesday)

What to know: The Mountaineers are 4-2 in the Big 12, a bit of a surprise. Outside of the upset of Kansas, they‚Äôve topped three of the bottom teams in the league, though.

This week: vs. Iowa State (Saturday)

What to know: The Cowboys have not won at TCU since 2017, a streak that continued with a nine-point collapse this week. That loss will sting come March, especially with Iowa State, BYU and Arizona in three of the next four games.

More: Oklahoma State basketball collapses late at TCU as David Punch stuns Cowboys

This week: at Arizona State (Saturday); vs. Baylor (Wednesday)

What to know: The Bearcats finally had a Big 12 winning streak, even taking down Iowa State. But nobody beats the No. 1- and No. 2-ranked teams in back-to-back games.

This week: vs. UCF (Saturday); at Iowa State (Thursday)

What to know: The Buffaloes have lost four straight games. In that span, their 3-point percentage has drastically fallen. For a team built on a high-powered offense, that‚Äôs a problem.

This week: vs. Cincinnati (Saturday); at UCF (Tuesday)

What to know: Sun Devils coach Bobby Hurley said a stretch of games against Arizona, BYU and Houston is like playing in the Final Four. His team didn‚Äôt quite respond well. ASU has lost 7 of 8 games.

This week: vs. Kansas (Saturday); at West Virginia (Tuesday)

What to know: Down to just seven players, the Wildcats topped Utah for their first win in league play. But losing sharpshooter Abdi Bashir Jr. to a foot injury is potentially devastating to a team already struggling.

What to know: The Utes have been scrappy, particularly in their last four games. Terrence Brown‚Äôs hot play has been a big reason.

Jacob Unruh is the deputy sports editor for The Oklahoman. Have a story idea for Jacob? He can be reached at junruh@oklahoman.com or on X/Twitter at @jacobunruh. Support Jacob's work and that of other Oklahoman journalists by purchasing a digital subscription today at subscribe.oklahoman.com.

title: Viktor Hovland reveals funniest thing an American fan said to him at the Ryder Cup
description: The 2025 Ryder Cup will be remembered as one of the most intense and chaotic editions in the event‚Äôs history. From the opening tee shot, the atmosphere was raucous, with the European team heckled relentlessly by the home crowd.
fullText:
The 2025 Ryder Cup will be remembered as one of the most intense and chaotic editions in the event‚Äôs history.

From the opening tee shot, the atmosphere was raucous, with the European team heckled relentlessly by the home crowd.

While some of the comments crossed the line, Viktor Hovland found humour in at least one of them.

The Norwegian, who played a key role for Europe, shared the moment that stood out most ‚Äì a rare example of wit amid the noise.

While much of the American crowd‚Äôs energy was directed toward unsettling Europe, one comment in particular made Hovland laugh.

He told Dan Rapaport: ‚ÄúOne said, ‚ÄòYeah, three Ryder Cups and no girlfriend. Kinda weird.‚Äô‚Äù

Known for his calm personality and sense of humour, the 28-year-old admitted that the remark was so unexpected that he couldn‚Äôt help but laugh.

The Norwegian‚Äôs reaction stood in stark contrast to some of his teammates, who were visibly frustrated by the constant heckling throughout the tournament.

The 2025 edition was widely described as the rowdiest Ryder Cup in history, with several moments where crowd behaviour pushed the boundaries of sportsmanship.

Still, Hovland‚Äôs ability to stay composed summed up the approach that has made him one of the most popular figures in modern golf.

Hovland was asked to put together his version of the ‚Äòperfect golfer,‚Äô combining the best qualities of the players he most admires.

His choices showed both his respect for his peers and his insight into what separates the elite from the rest.

The selections reflected Hovland‚Äôs deep respect for his peers and his understanding of what makes each player elite in their own way.

From McIlroy‚Äôs effortless power to Matsuyama‚Äôs creativity around the greens, his picks offered a thoughtful glimpse into how one of golf‚Äôs sharpest minds views greatness.

title: Injury crisis opens door for FORGOTTEN Liverpool midfielder
description: Liverpool took the decision to send Harvey Elliott on loan to Aston Villa on transfer deadline day.The 22-year-old - now a double Premier League title winner - was permitted to join Unai Emery‚Äôs sid...
fullText:
Liverpool took the decision to send Harvey Elliott on loan to Aston Villa on transfer deadline day.

The 22-year-old - now a double Premier League title winner - was permitted to join Unai Emery‚Äôs side on a one-season loan deal ahead of a potential permanent move.

The terms of the deal dictated that Elliott‚Äôs loan would become permanent once he played 10 first-team games for the Villans. But it looked as though his fate was sealed early - with no appearances in any competition since October and stuck on five games overall.

Liverpool have been linked with a move to bring Elliott back from his nightmare loan spell with Villa having little inclination to activate the ¬£35m clause.

However the England under-21 international would be severely limited in his options for the second half of the season if he did come back.

Shop the goalkeeper range today

Shop the third kit range today!

The Anfield club would be unable to send the playmaker on loan to another European club - as Elliott has already featured for two clubs in the 2025/26 season.

Therefore the midfielder is stuck in a limbo - unable to be fixed up with a new deal and with no chance of first-team football at Villa or Liverpool for that matter.

But Elliott could be set for an UNEXPECTED Aston Villa reprieve.

Following John McGinn‚Äôs knee injury against Everton at the weekend Villa are very much down to the bare bones in midfield.

The Scotland international joins Amadou Onana, Ross Barkley and Boubacar Kamara on the treatment table at Villa Park.

Emery is quickly running out of options in midfield - utilising Dutch defender Lamare Bogarde in the engine room against the Toffees.

With McGinn sidelined he opted to bring in Evann Guessand and shuffle his deck but he has got nowhere to turn for the upcoming weeks unless he offers the olive branch to Elliott.

It will be interesting to see what he does over the on-loan Liverpool star for the games against Fenerbahce on Thursday as well as Newcastle at the weekend.

No one is saying Elliott is going to reach the 10-game threshold in order to facilitate a permanent deal.

title: Paddy Pimblett makes UFC 324 debut after warning Dana White it won‚Äôt happen again
description: ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs the first and last time I will ever do a 12-week camp,‚Äù the Briton told talkSPORT. ‚ÄúI am never doing one of these again.
fullText:
‚ÄúIt‚Äôs the first and last time I will ever do a 12-week camp,‚Äù the Briton told talkSPORT.

‚ÄúI am never doing one of these again. It was too long. I was ready after five or six weeks, but because it was for a world title, we thought we had to do the full 12.‚Äù

What might be an issue for Pimblett is that he has become used to longer camps throughout his career, especially in the UFC.

But being given a world title shot has made this training camp even more intense and is reportedly something that Pimblett has not enjoyed at all.

Pimblett explained: ‚ÄúI am very glad I did it for this fight, though, but I‚Äôll never be doing another one unless it‚Äôs for Khabib [Nurmagomedov] in his comeback!‚Äù

UFC 324 will be a first for Pimblett, as he‚Äôs never fought in January before. And if his comments to new UFC host Kate Scott are anything to go by, it‚Äôs not something he plans on repeating.

During CBS‚Äô coverage of the UEFA Champions League, he made it clear that fighting this early in the year doesn‚Äôt suit him at all.

He also made sure Dana White and the UFC know that future January or February offers will be turned down before they‚Äôre even made.

‚ÄúI‚Äôve never fought this early before. This is the earliest I‚Äôve ever fought,‚Äù Pimblett said.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm never, ever fighting in January or February ever again. I just hope everyone at the UFC knows that because it ruined my Christmas and ruined my birthday.

Pimblett doubled down on his stance, urging fans not to expect any matches from him so early next year either: ‚ÄúNext year, get on me in March.‚Äù

Paddy Pimblett may be glad he didn‚Äôt go too heavy over Christmas, especially if it makes the weight cut down to 155 pounds a bit easier.

Just days out from UFC 324, Pimblett gave an update on his progress, saying things are looking good as he aims to hit the championship weight limit for the first time in his career.

‚ÄúI‚Äôve still got weight to lose but I‚Äôve got less weight to lose now than I did have 12 hours before I fought Michael Chandler,‚Äù he said during the same interview.

title: Report ‚Äì Inter Milan Post ‚Ç¨538m Revenue: Lead Italian Rivals Despite European Gap
description: Inter Milan have emerged as the best-performing Italian club in the European revenue rankings ahead of AC Milan and Juventus.According to Deloitte via FCInter1908, the Nerazzurri are knocking on the d...
fullText:
Inter Milan have emerged as the best-performing Italian club in the European revenue rankings ahead of AC Milan and Juventus.

According to Deloitte via FCInter1908, the Nerazzurri are knocking on the door of Europe‚Äôs top ten after the 2024/2025 Champions League campaign.

Despite a humiliating 5-0 defeat to Paris Saint-Germain in last season‚Äôs final, Inter Milan made a huge profit from their impressive European run.

Indeed, Inter‚Äôs total revenue has skyrocketed compared to the crisis experienced during the Covid-19 pandemic.

UDINE, ITALY ‚Äì SEPTEMBER 18:Piero Ausilio of FC Internazionale during the Serie A match between Udinese Calcio and FC Internazionale at Dacia Arena on September 18, 2022 in Udine, Italy. (Photo by Alessandro Sabattini/Getty Images)

Though no Serie A team has yet to reach the top ten of Europe‚Äôs revenue rankings, Inter could break the ice soon.

For context, the club‚Äôs 37% year-on-year growth, driven by Champions League success, puts the Nerazzurri on the brink of the top ten.

Furthermore, TV rights and commercial revenue grew the most, rising from ‚Ç¨112 million to ‚Ç¨153 million.

Therefore, Inter‚Äôs total revenue has hit an eye-watering ‚Ç¨538 million.

title: Inter advancing in a move for PSV‚Äôs Ivan Perisic
description: Inter are making significant strides toward a sensational return for Ivan Perisic, with negotiations already reaching an advanced stage.According to Alfredo Pedull√†, the Croatian international has gi...
fullText:
Inter are making significant strides toward a sensational return for Ivan Perisic, with negotiations already reaching an advanced stage.

According to Alfredo Pedull√†, the Croatian international has given his total approval to a move back to the San Siro. Discussions with Perisic‚Äôs entourage are well advanced as the Nerazzurri seek a reliable wide option to bolster Cristian Chivu‚Äôs squad, especially given the ongoing uncertainty surrounding Denzel Dumfries‚Äô fitness. Questions have been raised about Luis Henrique‚Äôs abilities too.

However, the timing of the deal hinges on PSV Eindhoven‚Äôs European journey. The Dutch side are currently in a delicate stretch of their campaign and will face Bayern Munich next Wednesday in a crucial Champions League clash. If PSV are eliminated from the competition, the path for Perisic‚Äôs departure is expected to clear immediately.

The 36-year-old‚Äôs desire to wear the Inter shirt again is the driving force behind the talks, and while the Italian giants remain respectful of PSV‚Äôs current commitments, an exit from Europe for the Eredivisie club could bring the transfer to life in the final days of the window.

title: USC ranked No. 20 in final college football AP Poll of season
description: The 2025 college football season is now in the books, which means the final AP Poll of the year is out. Where did the Trojans come in?
fullText:
On Monday night, Indiana defeated Miami¬†to win its first ever national championship. With it, the 2025 college football season is now officially in the books.

On Tuesday, the final AP Poll of the season was released. USC came in at No. 20‚Äîfour spots lower than where it ranked in the final regular season poll last month. The¬†Trojans dropped their final game of the year, falling 30-27 to TCU in the Alamo Bowl.

USC was one of six Big Ten teams ranked in the final poll. The national champion Hoosiers were No. 1, followed by No. 4 Oregon and No. 5 Ohio State. In addition, Iowa was ranked No. 17 and Michigan No. 21.

Does it make sense to have USC three spots behind an Iowa team that the Trojans finished with the same record as and beat head-to-head? No. Is it worth complaining about at this point? Also no. Finishing a few spots higher in the final poll would not have meant much for USC in the scheme of things.

Next season, USC is slated to face three of the top five teams from the final 2025 rankings. The Trojans will visit Indiana and host Ohio State and Oregon. It will certainly not be an easy road next year as USC enters what could be a make-or-break season for head coach Lincoln Riley.

This article originally appeared on Trojans Wire: USC football ranked No. 20 in final AP Poll of season

fullText:
Bombshell in the 2. Bundesliga! FC Schalke 04 has shaken up the winter transfer market with the signing of Edin D≈æeko.

The veteran Bosnian striker, 39 years old, arrives from AC Fiorentina to lead the Miners‚Äô attack during the final 16 matches of the 2025/2026 season.

D≈æeko, who will wear the number 10 shirt, returns to Germany where he was already a champion and top scorer with Wolfsburg.

According to Youri Mulder, the club‚Äôs sporting director, the striker showed immediate enthusiasm for the project, bringing the necessary leadership to a team looking to consolidate its growth in the second half of the season.

The Bosnian international highlighted Schalke‚Äôs positive evolution after difficult years. ‚ÄúI was impressed by how much the team has grown this season. I‚Äôm eager to play in front of a full VELTINS-Arena,‚Äù said the striker, who has already spoken with coach Miron Muslic and his compatriot Nikola Katic.

With an enviable career at clubs like Manchester City, Inter, and Roma, the "Bosnian Diamond" is now seeking one last successful dance in Gelsenkirchen. His arrival not only brings goals, but also vital leadership to the dressing room in the decisive stretch of the championship.

title: Liverpool player ratings vs Marseille: Salah struggles as Szoboszlai stars
description: Marseille 0-3 Liverpool: Goals from Dominik Szobozslai and Cody Gakpo, plus an own goal, ensured the Reds eased past their French opponents on Mohamed Salah‚Äôs return after Afcon
fullText:
Liverpool breezed past Marseille with a 3-0 victory at the Orange Velodrome in the Champions League, firing the Reds into the top eight of this season‚Äôs league phase.

With Mohamed Salah making his much-anticipated return to the starting XI after coming back from the Afcon, an audacious free-kick from Dominik Szoboszlai broke the deadlock for Liverpool on the stroke of half-time.

Jeremie Frimpong forced Marseille goalkeeper Geronimo Rulli to deflect the ball into his own net after 72 minutes before substitute Cody Gakpo managed to add a third in what turned out to be a memorable European night for Arne Slot‚Äôs side.

The last time the French side beat Liverpool was just shy of 20 years ago in 2007, and they didn‚Äôt pose any threat to changing that statistic. Liverpool have now extended their unbeaten run in all competitions to 13 games and Slot will be hoping that his team will be able to maintain the same composure when they travel to Bournemouth this weekend.

Here are The Independent‚Äôs player ratings for Liverpool‚Äôs win over Marseille:

Kept a clean sheet. He looked in control, commanding his area and comfortably claiming crosses, it was business as usual for the Brazilian veteran. He only had to make one real save from Amine Gouiri in the first half. The Liverpool shot-stopper may not quite be in his prime anymore but he still looks as safe a pair of hands as almost any keeper in world football. He also made a great save from a Mason Greenwood shot where the ball was bouncing awkwardly in front of him and made another good stop from Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang late on.

Effective and worked hard in both attacking and defensive positions, did well to get crosses in the box considering Marseille‚Äôs very wide shape. He could be shaping up to be one of Liverpool‚Äôs best signings this season. Frimpong was the key to Liverpool‚Äôs second goal which ultimately killed the game off, beating his man before Rulli parried the shot into his own net. He was everywhere constantly, not giving any Marseille player a moment‚Äôs rest, and dealt well with Igor Paixao who came on for Hamed Traore for the hosts.

Missed a header but it wouldn‚Äôt have counted anyway so that first career goal still eludes him. Worked well with Virgil van Dijk defensively in the first half, remained composed at the back and calmly dissolved many Marseille attacking chances. The centre-back looked good, especially given Ibrahima Konate has been starting ahead of him for a while now, and could be a more regular partner for Van Dijk moving forward.

Didn‚Äôt have much to do in the first half but dealt with Timothy Weah well and produced a typically ice-cool performance. He played his usual lofted passes into midfield, particularly to Dominik Szoboszlai and prevented a good chance with a very timely interception of Weah‚Äôs low driven shot in the 66th minute for Marseille.

It could‚Äôve easily been a hard night for Kerkez to deal with Mason Greenwood down the left flank, but he stood his ground well against the Marseille talisman, although he lacked some quality in his own delivery at times. He undoubtedly could‚Äôve been the best player on the pitch tonight if he‚Äôd had more quality in the final third but a classy defensive display from the left-back overall.

Tracked back well, didn‚Äôt have too much of the ball but made the Liverpool midfield tick. It was the Dutchman who won the free-kick in a dangerous position on the stroke of half-time which resulted in the goal. He played well given he wasn‚Äôt playing in his usual box-to-box role, getting an assist for Cody Gakpo in 92nd minute.

Came so close to scoring after just 20 minutes, played well throughout and contributed to some fluid attacking play. Although he‚Äôs not as effective as he once was for the Reds, his and Gravenberch‚Äôs understanding as a deep two in midfield showed. He linked up nicely with the forwards in the second half and was still kickstarting attacks all the way to the very end of the match.

Produced silky touches and still contributed defensively despite playing in behind Hugo Ekitike and Mohamed Salah as one of the twin 10s alongside Florian Wirtz. He made great runs and linked up well with Van Dijk, plus scored an audacious free-kick on his 100th start for the club, which was perfectly executed under the wall. You have to be a certain class of player to do that under those circumstances in the first of the two added minutes before half time. He then also played a huge part in the final goal, with a gorgeous touch to set Gravenberch away, who then assisted Gakpo. It‚Äôs seven goals in all competitions this season for the Hungarian and he is well on his way to becoming a free-kick specialist.

His first game since returning from Afcon was nothing to shout about for the Egyptian on the whole, although he played a brilliant ball in behind to Ekitike at one point and nearly scored a wonderful flicked goal after jumping high in the air to get on the end of a ball in from the right. However, it ended up on the roof of the net. He didn‚Äôt have his signature killer instinct in front of goal, fluffing a chance in the 83rd minute after bizarrely shooting with outside of the boot from close range and other players look like more potent attacking forces for Liverpool currently. Still a case of dusting off the cobwebs at the moment for Salah.

Timid from the German, who lacked sharpness and his normal quick feet. Multiple attacking build-ups ended with him mistiming his first touch, and was set up multiple times by Ekitike, only to miss a decent chance. Despite looking sharper in the second half, he didn‚Äôt have his signature class in front of goal in the final third.

So unlucky, hit the post with a lovely side-footed effort, posed a major offensive threat like he usually does, won multiple fouls and nearly broke the deadlock after 23 minutes when he finished smartly but the goal was ruled out for offside. He showed desire to get in behind, fed clever passes into the likes of Wirtz in 48th minute, who failed to get his shot off in time, and could‚Äôve very easily got an assist or two. He did practically everything but get his goal at the Orange Velodrome.

Didn‚Äôt see too much of the ball but put some good runs in behind to stretch a lethargic Marseille side and helped his team see the game out.

Almost made a quick impact as he played a lovely weighted pass into Salah which could‚Äôve wrapped up a demolition job in the 83rd minute. However he wrapped up it himself with a tidy finish, opening up his body to slot home in injury-time.

title: Scotland's McColl to play for Northants Women
description: Scotland all-rounder Megan McColl will play T20 cricket for Northamptonshire Women during the 2026 county season.
fullText:
Scotland all-rounder Megan McColl has signed to play T20 cricket for Northamptonshire Women during the 2026 county season.

The 25-year-old has won 60 international caps and helped Scotland to a five-wicket win over Zimbabwe in a World Cup qualifier in Nepal on Thursday.

Northamptonshire reached the semi-finals in the tier two One-Day Cup last summer but missed out on the knockout stage of the T20 Blast after finishing third in their group.

They will again be captained by Anisha Patel in the 50-over competition, and Gemma Marriott in the shorter format.

"We're all very pleased with how the squad looks for the upcoming season - there's a lot of continuity from last year with the leaders around the group but there are also a healthy amount of new faces," said head coach David Ripley.

"We had a productive season last year and now it's all about building on that and hopefully seeing ourselves in the latter stages of all competitions."

The Steelbacks squad includes several players on dual registration from tier one sides - Essex's Emma Gibbs, Mabel Reid and Clara Thaker, The Blaze's Emily Carpenter, Warwickshire's Ava Clive and Bethan Robinson and Ameila Kemp of Yorkshire.

Scotland secure first group win against Zimbabwe

Get cricket news sent straight to your phone

title: Real Madrid attacking duo back in group training ahead of Villarreal clash
description: Real Madrid have received a timely double boost ahead of their upcoming La Liga clash against Villarreal, with a report from Melchor Ruiz confirming that both Rodrygo and Brahim Diaz have returned to ...
fullText:
Real Madrid have received a timely double boost ahead of their upcoming La Liga clash against Villarreal, with a report from Melchor Ruiz confirming that both Rodrygo and Brahim Diaz have returned to training.

Rodrygo‚Äôs comeback is particularly significant given his recent absence from competitive action.

The Brazilian forward has been sidelined for a period after suffering physical problems during the Spanish Super Cup.

Those issues forced him to miss Real Madrid‚Äôs last two domestic fixtures against Albacete and Levante, before also being ruled out of the midweek encounter against AS Monaco.

Now back on the training pitch, Rodrygo‚Äôs return gives the coaching staff more attacking options as preparations intensify for the Villarreal match.

While his availability for the weekend will depend on how his physical condition responds in the final sessions, his presence alone is a positive sign.

The 25-year-old remains an important piece in Madrid‚Äôs attacking structure, and his recovery comes at a crucial moment in the season.

Brahim‚Äôs return carries a very different emotional context.

Brahim Diaz has returned to training. (Photo by Angel Martinez/Getty Images)

This is because the attacking midfielder has just completed international duty with Morocco at the Africa Cup of Nations.

Notably, this tournament ended in heartbreak, as Morocco lost the final to Senegal, with Brahim missing a decisive penalty.

Despite returning clearly affected by the outcome of that final, those close to the player insist that he also comes back mentally strengthened.

In many ways, it is a renewed version of Brahim who re-joins the squad, motivated to channel that experience into his club performances.

Sportingly, Brahim is once again fighting for something familiar ‚Äì a place in Real Madrid‚Äôs starting lineup.

Competition is fierce, particularly on the right side of attack, where Franco Mastantuono is also pushing for opportunities.

Rodrygo‚Äôs return further intensifies that battle, even if the Brazilian is only just working his way back to full fitness.

title: Ranking the top 10 MLB teams entering 2026 Spring Training
description: Pitchers and catchers have their first workouts from February 9th to February 13th. This offseason saw many players move in the form of trades and free agency. As anticipation starts for the 2026 season, baseball fans are beginning to home‚Ä¶
fullText:
Pitchers and catchers have their first workouts from February 9th to February 13th. This offseason saw many players move in the form of trades and free agency. As anticipation starts for the 2026 season, baseball fans are beginning to home in on their favorite teams.

Fans begin to research rosters, minor league prospects, and the 2026 schedules. Spring Training baseball brings hope to fans anxiously awaiting their favorite team to reach World Series glory. Here are the top 10 MLB teams heading into Spring Training.

Detroit rosters MLB‚Äôs best starting pitcher in Tarik Skubal. The Tigers could trade their superstar if a long-term extension can‚Äôt be reached. If Skubal is traded, the Tigers will be in need of a number one starting pitcher.

The team‚Äôs lineup features young players and blossoming superstar Riley Greene. This offseason, the front office helped strengthen Detroit‚Äôs bullpen.

Last season, Houston missed the playoffs for the first time since 2016. The team‚Äôs shortcomings were due to injuries, most notably to Yordan Alvarez and team closer Josh Hader. This offseason, the Astros added free agent Japanese pitcher Tatsuya Imai.

Imai joins Hunter Brown and Christian Javier in Houston‚Äôs starting rotation. The key to Houston‚Äôs upcoming season is health.

On paper, teams are better than the Brewers, but the front office and coaching staff get the best out of the team‚Äôs roster. Last season, Milwaukee‚Äôs top starting pitching prospect, Jacob Misiorowski, made his debut and took the league by storm.

Misiorowski will join Freddie Peralta at the top of the team‚Äôs starting rotation. The Brewers‚Äô lineup will again be led by Christian Yelich, Brice Turang, and last season‚Äôs breakout outfielder, Jackson Chourio.

Boston was led by ace starting pitcher Garrett Crochet in 2025. The starter had the best season of his career and will produce more production in 2026. The team lost third baseman Alex Bregman in free agency, but the lineup features Trevor Story, Jarren Duran, Wilyer Abreu, Roman Anthony, and newly acquired hitter Willson Contreras.

The Red Sox bolstered their rotation, signing starting pitcher Sonny Gray. If Boston can successfully slide prospect Marcelo Mayer into Bregman‚Äôs void, they can reach the playoffs again in 2026.

The Yankees have the lineup to win the World Series, but continue to fall short. Any team with Aaron Judge will always have the chance to win. The Yankees haven‚Äôt made a splash in free agency, but the upcoming season will feature the return of starting pitcher Gerrit Cole.

Cole will rejoin the starting rotation that features Max Fried, Carlos Rodon, and breakout candidate Cam Schlitter. With Cody Bellinger locked up long-term, the glaring questions are whether shortstop Anthony Volpe can fix his consistency issues and if the pitching staff can stay healthy throughout the season.

Chicago started the first half of 2025 as one of MLB‚Äôs best teams. However, the Cubs regressed mightily in the second half. This offseason, the team lost outfielder Kyle Tucker in free agency but signed Alex Bregman to fill the glaring hole at third base. The front office acquired starting pitcher Edward Cabrera, and he will join starting pitchers Shota Imanaga, James Taillon, Cade Horton, and Matthew Boyd.

Starting pitcher Justin Steele returns to the starting rotation after missing all of 2025 to elbow surgery. After outfielder Pete Crow-Armstrong‚Äôs breakout season, the Cubs‚Äô lineup is projected to be one of the strongest in Major League Baseball.

Barring injuries, Seattle‚Äôs rotation has the chance to be one of the league‚Äôs best. It‚Äôs difficult to name a starting five better than the combination of Luis Castillo, Logan Gilbert, Bryan Woo, George Kirby, and Bryce Miller. The group makes up the best strength of the Mariners‚Äô roster.

They came up short during last season‚Äôs playoff push but brings back a lineup that features Cal Raleigh, Josh Naylor, Randy Arozarena, and Julio Rodriguez. Seattle will be the team to beat in the AL West.

The Phillies are the best National League team to dethrone the Los Angeles Dodgers. Last season, Philadelphia fell to Los Angeles in the NLDS. Unfortunately, the team was without starting pitcher Zack Wheeler and is likely to begin 2026 without its ace. With Ranger Suarez leaving in free agency, the Phillies will look to Christopher Sanchez, Aaron Nola, and Jesus Luzardo as their top three starters.

Prospect Andrew Painter will have the opportunity to break Spring Training in the rotation, and he has one of the best arms of any minor league prospect. Philadelphia‚Äôs lineup returns veterans J.T. Realmuto, Bryce Harper, Trea Turner, Kyle Schwarber, and free agent acquisition Adolis Garcia. Outfielder Nick Castellanos is likely to be traded before Spring Training.

Toronto was one of MLB‚Äôs top teams throughout the 2025 season. The Blue Jays represented the American League in the World Series but fell to the Dodgers in seven games. This season, Toronto looks to repeat as American League pennant winners. Its starting pitching rotation of Kevin Gausman, Dylan Cease, Shane Bieber, Jose Berrios, and postseason standout Trey Yesavage can be one of the top rotations in MLB.

They added to their lineup this season, adding Japanese free agent Kazuma Okamoto. The team hopes Okamoto will mitigate lost production following shortstop Bo Bichette‚Äôs signing with the Mets. The Japanese free agent will be included in a lineup that features Vladimir Guerrero Jr., Anthony Santander, Addison Barger, Daulton Varsho, and George Springer.

LA enters Spring Training as the top team in Major League Baseball. Their roster features Shohei Ohtani, the league‚Äôs best player, and they added Kyle Tucker as a free agent.

Tucker joins the best lineup, top to bottom, and is positioned to have the best season of his career. If the starting rotation can stay healthy, the group of Yoshinobu Yamamoto, Tyler Glasnow, Blake Snell, Roki Sasaki, and Shohei Ohtani can finish as the league‚Äôs top-ranked staff.

The front office brought in free agent closer Edwin Diaz to secure the ninth inning of ball games. For all the negative talk about the front office‚Äôs spending, one thing is clear: team ownership wants to win every season.

Check out all of our NFL articles: https://www.thebiglead.com/category/nfl/

The post Ranking the top 10 MLB teams entering 2026 Spring Training appeared first on The Big Lead.

title: Roma renew interest in Wolves winger David Moller Wolfe
description: After the arrivals of Robinio Vaz and Donyell Malen and the departure of Leon Bailey, Roma continues to work on the transfer market. Sporting director Frederic Massara‚Äôs goals are to strengthen the ...
fullText:
After the arrivals of Robinio Vaz and Donyell Malen and the departure of Leon Bailey, Roma continues to work on the transfer market.

Sporting director Frederic Massara‚Äôs goals are to strengthen the defensive and offensive flanks, trying to free up space with new departures.

As they are in the process of completing Tommaso Baldanzi‚Äôs exit to Genoa, Roma have reportedly turned their attention to Wolves attacker David Moller Wolfe.

According to Radio Man√†Man√† Sport, the Giallorossi have renewed their interest in Wolfe who had already been linked with the capital club in the past.

The Norwegian is reportedly keen to leaving the Premier League and could consider a move to Serie A.

title: Ospreys squad hope to make fans proud against Lions
description: Ospreys head coach Mark Jones says his squad will attempt to do the under-fire region proud when they face the Lions in Bridgend.
fullText:
Ospreys head coach Mark Jones says his squad will attempt to do the under-fire region proud when they face Lions in the United Rugby Championship (URC) on Friday night in Bridgend.

Welsh rugby was plunged into fresh crisis after it emerged Ospreys owners - Y11 Sport & Media - were the preferred bidders in a deal to purchase Cardiff from the Welsh Rugby Union.

The WRU has proposed cutting one of its four men's professional sides - Cardiff, Dragons, Ospreys and Scarlets - to the dismay of fans across the country.

Ospreys had a stormy meeting with chief executive Lance Bradley where "one or two of the players" walked out early, while a full contact training session was cancelled.

Jones - who makes 10 changes to the starting XV for the game - says it has been a tough week and not ideal preparation but says his side will try to focus on matters on the field.

"I'm confident that on Friday night, the Ospreys supporters will see a group of men and women working on behalf of the Ospreys trying to get a result," said Jones.

"Hopefully they'll be proud of the effort they're seeing from the group."

Lions assistant coach Wessel Roux says he is expecting an Ospreys backlash from the off-the-field controversy.

"There's a lot of uncertainty in Welsh rugby at the moment," said Wessels.

"I think everybody wants to fight and put their best foot forward. They'll be an absolutely hungry side and will want to make a statement."

This could prove a crucial battle for both sides in the race to finish in the top eight and reach the URC play-offs, with the Lions currently seventh and the Ospreys ninth.

Centre Keiran Williams will make his 100th appearance in the much-changed side from the team that lost in the Challenge Cup against Montpellier.

Only wing Daniel Kasende, centre Owen Watkin, prop Steffan Thomas, lock Rhys Davies and number eight Morgan Morris keep their starting spots.

Wales captain Dewi Lake and fellow internationals Dan Edwards, Kieran Hardy, James Ratti and Harri Deaves return, alongside Australian lock Ryan Smith.

Lions centre Henco van Wyk will make his 50th appearance for the South African side.

Welsh rugby rallies around crisis-hit Ospreys

Ospreys told of Cardiff interest as players walk out of meeting
